column4: my system monitor is full screen and it has no title bars. I can't make it a window. how do i do it?
my system monitor is full screen and it has no title bars. I can't make it a window. how do i do it?
how u do it?
i can found any full screen options in it )
i don't know... it just happened and now i can't scale it or even get the title bar back...
u can move window by ALT+move mouse
I can for all the other windows but not for this one...
kill it by xkill
i can stop them with alt f4 but then it opens up again full screen...
miracle )))
dont know what to say...
i've never seen anything like it...!!!
and what system monitor r u using?
strange...
kill it in terminal
run ps -e f |grep monitor
get the process id and kill it by - kill <pid>
doesn't give me anything unless i open it first...
can u kill X-server? if u can press ctrl+alt+backspace
yes but even after a restart it is still the same...
it will drop all yout applications run
!!! very strange
